bibl.title: Letter from Wilburt C. Davison to Emilie Lawrence Reed, March 9, 1931

div1.p: Davison invites Emilie Lawrence Reed to attend the dedication of Duke University Hospital. He lists the wards named for distinguished physicians, including one named for Walter Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Wilburt C. Davison to Emilie Lawrence Reed, March 9, 1931
div1.opener:
Duke University
DURHAM
NORTH CAROLINA
March 9, 1931.
School of Medicine
Office of the Dean
Please Reply to Undersigned
Box 3701
Mrs. Walter Reed
Burlington Hotel
Vermont Ave.
Washington, D. C.
Dear Mrs. Reed:
div1.p:
The Duke University School of Medicine
and Duke Hospital will be dedicated on Monday,
April 20th, and I hope that you will be able to
attend. The wards of the Duke Hospital are named
for the distinguished physicians and surgeons listed
below, and we are anxious to have as many as possible
of the relatives of those for whom the wards are
named.

The best way of reaching Durham is to
take the Seaboard Air Line train which leaves the
Union Station in Washington, D. C., at 11:59. P.M., and
which arrives in Raleigh, N. C., at 7:05 in the morning.
I shall meet you in Raleigh if you can come.
div1.closer: Yours sincerely, Wilburt C. Davison. Sir William Osler, (Can., Pa., Md., & Eng.) William H. Welch (Conn., & Md.) Henry Fraser Campbell (Ga.) Daniel Drake (N.J. & Ky.) Walter Reed (Va.) James Lawrence Cabell (Va.) Edmund Charles Fox Strudwick (N.C.) Crawford Williamson Long (Ga.) Ephraim McDowell (Va. & Ky.) William Stewart Halsted (N.Y. & Md.) J. Marion Sims (S.C., Ala., & N.Y.) Francois Prevost (La.) Josiah Clark Nott (S.C. & Ala.) John Howland (N.Y. & Md.)
